H0.text: Molten rock flowing in the asthenosphere is the direct cause of the frequent changes in Earth's magnetic pole location.

H1.text: Convection cells in the lower mantle are the direct cause of the frequent changes in Earth's magnetic pole locations.

H2.text: Turbulence in the liquid outer core is the direct cause of the frequent changes in Earth's magnetic pole locations.

H3.text: Radioactive decay in the solid inner core is the direct cause of the frequent change in Earth's magnetic pole location.
